Entries.default:
"Gótvadhjur, fellow traveler. I've rymsjódda, if you seek to banish the chill."

The elf fills a tankard from a cask, a slight smile curving his beard, before passing it to you.
"Is there aught you require?"
"Show me what you have for sale."
"What brought you here?"
[Leave] "Never mind."
"You said you're trying to brew the perfect beer?"
"A boat."
"We brew rymsjódda not merely for its taste, but as a ward against the deadly cold."
"The world's end may be nigh, but until then, I furnish what you seek."
"Alcohol brings a bit of oblivion upon us, if only temporarily. It's my life's work, brewing the perfect rymsjódda. The difficulty lies in getting the right ingredients."
"I have not been a warrior for many years, and the machines bear weapons and shields."
"You return. Is it too much to hope that you do so bearing fluid from a rime construct?"
"Here you are."
"Fantastic. I can mix it into the first batch immediately."
"Not so fast."
"Here you go."
"Is it? Well, hardly surprising. All things end. What matter if some sooner than others?" He accepts the flask.
"Dhakklátur! Excuse me, I must add this immediately!"
"Not entirely unexpected. Still, he seemed to enjoy it. For a time."

"Were you to harvest fluid from one of them, I would happily compensate you for it - in coin or trade."

He pauses for a moment, considering.
"Your beer killed that Harbinger!"
"Indeed, Rymrgand has called him into Oblivion. Far worse ways to go, if I do say so."
"Maybe you should take a swig of it yourself."
"Heh, no, no. Rymrgand marks our endings. I would never hazard begrudging him the choice."
"This is... it's certainly something. Spicy, yet sweet."
"Oh... it's... the colors. Sweet Oblivion, Nyvardir, I think you've got something here..."
"Is it... I feel a bit... as if I'm in a long ship on a mad sea... Urk, gods..."
"Rymsjódda?"
[Accept the drink.] "To the Beast of Winter."
[Accept the drink.] "I appreciate it."
[Refuse the drink.] "No thanks."
"It's a beer. Brewed and aged in colder climes to fight back the biting frost. Beloved here, as I'm sure you can imagine."
"Ja, the very spirit of the place."
"Think nothing of it. With new Harbingers arriving weekly, we provide what little welcome we can in this desolate place."

"As you will."

He withdraws the lager, taking a sip of it himself.
"Developed a taste for our drink, have you? I'll oblige it, for coin or trade."
"You don't know of rymsjódda? Not from the coastal White, are you?"
"You've not had it? I almost envy you the first trying!"

"Oi there now, cap. If the lad be offering a quaff for the taking, it be right discourteous of us not to have a taste!"

He claims the flagon and takes a long swig.
"Got anything stronger maybe? It's been a long voyage and some of us have seen things we'd rather forget."
"Captain, where is your courage?" Tekēhu accepts the tankard and gingerly sips at the foam.
"Well I certainly ain't refusing his hospitality on account of you."
One of Ydwin's pale eyebrows arches at you from above a carmine eye.
"Changed your mind about that drink? I'm happy to provide - in fair exchange for coin or trade."
"Welcome back, brother."
"I meant specifically."
"Me too!"
[Chuckle politely.]
[Say nothing.]
"A long ship bore me. With a single mast and oars. Specifically."
"It is not a place one swims to, ja?"
He nods, accompanying the small gesture with a slight smirk.
He shrugs, holding your gaze.
"I did and I am, though proper ingredients can be difficult to come by at the Watch."
"Doesn't what makes the perfect beer depend on the imbiber?"
"Why bother if the world is going to end?"
"What ingredients are you looking for?"
"I want to talk about something else."
"Talk then."

"Why bother if it isn't? Because I want to. Because I enjoy the challenge. Because I love beer."

Smiling, he rests a hand on his stomach.
"I am under no illusion that my work will outlast me, or even that it will have import to anyone else."
"Why lose sleep over trivialities outside of my control?"
"No." He grins.
"Care to elaborate?"
"I do not."
"It serves well enough along the coasts of the White, but further south - or here at the Watch, for that matter - well, it could be improved."
"I've seen machines striding the icebergs - kith-shaped things of metal, little impacted by the chill. I suspect them filled with some substance that keeps them warm."
"I've more than half a mind to add a little of that - whatever it is - to the latest batch."
"I'll see what I can find."
"That sounds like it could be unhealthy."
"Are you entirely insane?"
"...let's discuss something else."
"It may well not be. We will not know until we try it, will we?"
"Not entirely, no. Nor would I claim to be wholly rational."
"I would be indebted."
"Of course. Name your subject."
"Is it the months long night that drives your people to madness, Ydwin, or is it the cold?"
"This one surrounds himself with the Deadfire's sharpest wits." She indicates you with a wave of her hand.
Entries.female: "This one surrounds herself with the Deadfire's sharpest wits." She gestures at you.

Entries.default: "Captain, I've been thinking. We should probably reconsider sending Ydwin into battle."
"If I didn't know better, Ydwin, I'd say Gaun cast the two of you from the very same mold."
Recoiling, he drops his hand to his side.
"What?"
"I can't give you this. It's ridiculously toxic."
[Destroy the fluid.] "No. I won't let you give this to others."
"I'll hand it over, but you should know that it's highly toxic."
"We haven't discussed the matter of payment."
"And? Death is a fact of life!"
"Here, I've this ring. From the temple. Such magic! Trade it for the fluid? Or coin? I've coin. Four thousand coins!"
"Oh, of course. I'd be willing to offer this magical ring I found in the temple in trade. Or, if you'd prefer coin, I can offer four thousand copper pires."
"I want both."
"I'll take the enchanted ring."
"I'd prefer the coin."
"Make it eight thousand copper, and you've got a deal."
Nyvardir glares as you spill the fluid on to the floor. He hisses at you and turns away.
"Both?" He hisses.
"Fine! Here, take it. Now hand over the fluid!"
[Give him the liquid.] "Here."
[Destroy the fluid.] "Absolutely not."
"What? It is mine by right!" He lunges towards you.
"Give it to me!"
"Here, lad. Drink deeply, to the Beast of Winter."
"Any drink's good drink, you ask me. Even that watered down bilge-rot the Dawnstars drink mixes well with rum."
"You mix mead and rum? Truly this world deserves Rymrgand's cleansing attentions."
"Sounds like a right good time, that does."
"Or not."

"I didn't expect you to bring back half this much. Or really even any at all.
Here, I can mix it into the first batch immediately."
"Thats... well, plenty! Enough for batches! Here, I can mix it into the first batch immediately."
"Well... you did bring back quite a lot of the stuff. Fine. Here."
"I'll accept as much of the stuff as you can bring me. I'm sure I can find some use for it."
"I see you've returned. Fine. I'll accept your coin."
"Well... you did bring back quite a lot of the stuff. Fine. Here."
"The ice beast arrives!"
